$DOT  dropped 3.68% to $2.21, underperforming the broader market as bearish technicals and weak sentiment converged. Price remains below the 30-day SMA at $2.46, with RSI around 45 reflecting fading momentum, while resistance near the $2.50 Fibonacci zone capped recent upside after a failed breakout above $2.39.   ETF-related optimism also cooled after Bitwise‚Äôs crypto index assigned $DOT  just a 0.14% weighting, triggering sell-the-news pressure amid broader altcoin risk-off behavior as Bitcoin dominance climbed to 58.46% and liquidity thinned, with 24h volume down 19%.   While short-term support near $2.19‚Äì$2.20 is holding, a sustained close above $2.27 is needed to ease downside pressure‚Äîwill $DOT  regain traction if market sentiment improves, or does Bitcoin dominance keep suppressing altcoin rebounds? The Fed just cut 25 bps again ‚Äî bringing rates down to 3.50%‚Äì3.75%.
That‚Äôs the 3rd straight cut, 75 bps total this year.

But the dot plot?
üëâ Only 1 cut expected next year.
üëâ More tiny cuts pushed out to 2026‚Äì27.

Powell says the labor market is cooling, inflation‚Äôs still a bit sticky, and risks lean upward ‚Äî meaning they‚Äôre not in a rush to cut further.

FOMC TLDR: 

- Hawkish 25bps cut
- 3 dissents (most since 2019)
- Inflation still a big concern
- Median dot plot forecast for 2026 only 25bps cut
- Limited buying of short-term securities

üßê Last night‚Äôs $BTC/ $ETH move was a classic: hype pushed it up, reality brought it back.

FOMC cut 25bps (as expected), but the dot plot basically said:
‚ÄúDon‚Äôt count on fast easing next year.‚Äù

So the market flipped from emotion ‚Üí back to data mode.

From here, it‚Äôs all about how jobs, inflation, and wage numbers shape liquidity expectations ‚Äî not guessing up or down.

Low liquidity + no clear consensus = every small flow looks huge on the chart.

Right now the biggest trap isn‚Äôt picking the wrong direction.
It‚Äôs thinking the market should be clear when it isn‚Äôt.
